story:
Once upon a time, in the lush and beautiful land of Thailand, there was a small village nestled between a dense jungle and a calm river. The villagers were simple and content, living off the bounty of the land and river. The most beautiful part of the village was a giant banyan tree which stood tall and proud in the center of the village. It was believed that the tree was home to a magical guardian, who protected the village from danger and brought them good fortune.

One day, a young girl named Ning decided to climb the banyan tree to see if the stories were true. As she climbed higher and higher, she finally reached the top of the tree, finding a hidden entrance to a hidden treehouse. Ning cautiously entered the treehouse and to her astonishment, she found a magnificent and kind-looking elephant. The elephant was adorned with a beautiful gold headdress and sapphire eyes that sparkled in the dim light.

The elephant introduced itself as Por-Gae, the guardian of the village. Por-Gae explained that it was their duty to protect the village from all harm and bring them good fortune. Ning was amazed and grateful that she had found the guardian, and Por-Gae was too, as they had been looking for someone kind-hearted and strong-willed, just like Ning.

Por-Gae said that the village was in danger, as a wicked witch who lived deep in the jungle was planning to cast a spell on the village and turn everyone into stone. However, Ning and Por-Gae could stop her together.

Ning bravely agreed to help and Por-Gae handed her a small vial of magical water they had been saving for this very moment. Ning was to pour the water on the witch's spellcasting stone, and it would break the spell and turn the witch back into a mortal.

Together, Ning and Por-Gae set off into the jungle, making their way towards the witch's lair. As they approached, Ning saw the witch casting her spell, and she swiftly poured the magical water on the spellcasting stone. The stone instantly shattered, and the witch was shocked to find herself transformed back into her mortal form.

"Who are you to interfere with my plans?" she spat.

Ning stood tall and answered, "I am Ning, the chosen guardian of the village, and I will never let anyone harm my home."

The witch was furious, but she knew she was defeated. She disappeared back into the jungle, vowing revenge, but Ning and Por-Gae knew they had saved the village.

From that day on, Ning and Por-Gae were inseparable, and Ning learned the secrets of the magical treehouse. They worked together to protect the village and bring them good fortune, and the village flourished under their care.

As the years passed, Ning grew up to be a wise and strong leader, always remembering the lesson she had learned from her adventure - to stand up for what she believed in and protect those she loved. And the village, filled with joy and prosperity, thrived and lived happily ever after, under the watchful guard of Ning and Por-Gae.

Now, my dear child, with love in my heart, I bid you goodnight and sweet dreams, as the world of magic and wonder awaits you in your dreams. Remember, be brave and believe in yourself, just like Ning, and you can achieve anything. Goodnight!
